name: df-evl1
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(ce1, cmpt(s0, universe, csb(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), ccom(cmpt(s2, co(cv(s1), cmap, co(cv(s1), cmap, c1o)), ccom(cv(s2), cmpt(s3, cv(s1), cxp(c1o, csn(cv(s3)))))), co(c1o, cevl, cv(s0))))))
bodyPretty: âŠ¢ eval1 =(s0 âˆˆ ð•Œ â†¦[(Base ` s0)/ s1]((s2 âˆˆ(s1[â†¦](s1[â†¦]1o))â†¦(s2 âˆ˜(s3 âˆˆ s1 â†¦(1o Ã— { s3 }))))âˆ˜(1o[eval]s0)))
comment: Define the evaluation map for the univariate polynomial algebra. The function ` ( eval1 `` R ) : V --> ( R ^m R ) ` makes sense when ` R ` is a ring, and ` V ` is the set of polynomials in ` ( Poly1 `` R ) ` . This function maps an element of the formal polynomial algebra (with coefficients in ` R ` ) to a function from assignments to the variable from ` R ` into an element of ` R ` formed by evaluating the polynomial with the given assignment. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jun-2015.)
